ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '14'
libhwloc:
- 2.12.2
target_platform:
- linux-64
ucx:
- '1.20'
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
  - fortran_compiler_version

about.description:
ParaStation MPI relies on a low-level communication layer called `pscom` and provides full MPI-4 compliance.

Since it is configured with the Process Management Interface for Exascale (PMIx), an external job launcher
is required to run MPI jobs spawning multiple nodes, typically in a high-performance computing environment.

For instance using the Slurm Workload Manager, applications would be executed with:

```
srun --mpi=pmix mpi_application
```

For single-node jobs (here with 2 processes) use instead `prterun` :

```
prterun -np 2 ./mpi_application"
```
about.summary: ParaStation MPI is an MPIch based implementation of the Message-Passing Interface (MPI) Standard.

about.summary: ParaStation MPI is an MPIch based implementation of the Message-Passing Interface (MPI) Standard.

name: psmpi
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "5.13.0" %}
{% set pscom_version = "6.0.0" %}

package:
  name: psmpi
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  - url: https://github.com/ParaStation/psmpi/archive/refs/tags/{{ version }}-1.tar.gz
    sha256: 21cf9b1f944ae9f331a4f5fbba83b328952fd25fda55fb608df27d065d3e2010
    folder: psmpi
    patches:
      - fix-cross-file-check.patch
  - url: https://github.com/ParaStation/pscom/archive/refs/tags/{{ pscom_version }}-1.tar.gz
    sha256: 9e7d5ea30a006fa794c246e76afda0d3d1b486d4cae097c6e2181fbbc15e0ea3
    folder: pscom
    patches:
      - remove-internal-cookie-include.patch

build:
  number: 0
  run_exports:
    - {{ pin_subpackage('psmpi', max_pin='x.y.z') }}
  skip: true  # [win or osx]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - autoconf 
    - automake
    - cmake
    - git
    - libtool
    - make
  host:
    - libhwloc
    - libpmix-devel
    - prrte
    - ucx
  run:
    - libhwloc
    - openssh
    - prrte
    - ucx

test:
  requires:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}
  files:
    - hello_world_mpi.f90
  commands:
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libmpi.so
    - mpifort -o hello_world_mpi hello_world_mpi.f90
    - prterun --map-by :HWTCPUS:OVERSUBSCRIBE -np 2 ./hello_world_mpi

about:
  home: https://github.com/ParaStation/psmpi
  license: QPL-1.0
  license_family: OTHER
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: ParaStation MPI is an MPIch based implementation of the Message-Passing Interface (MPI) Standard.
  description: |
    ParaStation MPI relies on a low-level communication layer called `pscom` and provides full MPI-4 compliance.

    Since it is configured with the Process Management Interface for Exascale (PMIx), an external job launcher 
    is required to run MPI jobs spawning multiple nodes, typically in a high-performance computing environment.

    For instance using the Slurm Workload Manager, applications would be executed with:

    ```
    srun --mpi=pmix mpi_application
    ```

    For single-node jobs (here with 2 processes) use instead `prterun` :

    ```
    prterun -np 2 ./mpi_application"
    ```

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - j34ni
